column5: For the pier and river anglers out there! Are the salmon starting to move in with all this rain? Close enough to catch them from the piers?  Thanks a lot!
Lemme guess..  It's an hour drive to your nearest pier?!?!
About half an hour maybe. I just have saturday morning to get out so I don't wanna go to the piers and there be nothing there. Know what I mean?
I got 3 last night on a 5/0 treble and pink marshmallow.
That's amazing!! Any pics? . I'm new to pier fishing so I'm just learning everything.
You don't have to worry about nothing being there . . . they'll be plenty there.  Whether any of the life there has fins or not is anyone's guess.
ahah, yeah you never know! Are you suggesting that there will be Salmon or just a mere joke about the pollution in lake Ontario?
Don't bother taking a rod, just a net will do
I'm sure Billsthebassman is referring to the number of people (no fins) that will be there. You best get out really early to get a good spot.
Dan, you've really been making me laugh on these salmon threads - kudos.  Someone should film a "fishing" show at the rivers when the Salmon run, if Dave Mercer did it, it would be epic!
I'm going out for Lake Ontario Salmon tonight..  If I catch one, I'll post a report, and if I don't, I won't

the river is plum full of salmon at port hope .. my son has made a killing down there so far he has found a fillet knife and 3  10 .00 repalas keep it up and i wont have to buy him nothing for christmas ..  the snaggers were out in full force there were 4 down there and they were so proud of there snagging they took  pictures of there catch then released them .. i had my finger in the mnr tips line ... mabey next time
WTH?? Snagging to keep it, while inexcusable still makes more sense than snagging then releasing it
I'm not sure if a WFN Vlog will work
I'm shooting the 3rd episode of a fishing show shortly and you gave me an idea for #4
Sweet, but toss me some on air props!
